intro: Microsechium guatemalense, commonly known as the Guatemalan microsechium, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
